sentences.sContent: Studying the ecology of carnivores in the rainforest, he thinks like a desperate civet running out of territory.
sentences.sContent_eng: Studying the ecology of carnivores in the rainforest, he thinks like a desperate civet running out of territory.
sentences.sCn: 主攻热带雨林肉食动物生态学的他，思考起来像是跑出领地的绝望麝猫。

sentences.sContent: I’m sorting through and organizing years of tracking and recapture data from my civet fieldwork.
sentences.sContent_eng: I’m sorting through and organizing years of tracking and recapture data from my civet fieldwork.
sentences.sCn: 我在整理组织几年来的拍摄作品并重温麝猫的野外研究数据。

synos.tran: [中医]麝猫，香猫；[轻]麝猫香，灵猫香

trans.tranOther: any catlike viverrine mammal of the genus Viverra and related genera, of Africa and S Asia, typically having blotched or spotted fur and secreting a powerfully smelling fluid from anal glands
